moves.1. d4 d5 2. Nd2: ?! Hmm... I suppose he's headed for the stonewall, but I don't really like this move it blocks in his DSB.
moves.2... c5: Well I'm the most comfortable with the queen's gambit so why not?
moves.3. c3 cxd4 4. cxd4 Nc6: Now that the c pawns are gone his knight on d2 looks a little out of place.
moves.5. e3: Well he continues with his stonewall anyway.
moves.5... Bf5 6. a3: ?! I don't think this accomplishes much.
moves.6... e6 7. f4: Common in stonewall, this creates a huge hole on e4 which a black knight loves to fill.
moves.7... Bd6: I develop my bishop to a nice square.
moves.9. Ne5 Bxe5 10. fxe5: I know that the doubled f pawns are very common in the stonewall.
moves.10... Ne4: He can trade but then I get a *very* nice bishop instead of a *very* nice knight.
moves.12. g3 Nxg3: ! Discovers an attack on his bishop, and his pawn is pinned to his rook.
moves.13. Nf3: Discovering a defense to his bishop and attacking my queen. Good move.
moves.15. Qxh1: Well after that skirmish has died down the dust settles leaving me... Up by the exchange and a pawn.
moves.15... Bxd3 16. Kxd3: His king is out in the center and it's still only the middlegame... But I don't have many pieces developed so maybe he's okay.
moves.16... Qf5+ 17. Ke2 Qe4: My queen is very nicely situated on e4, it's central and it pins his knight. Black has a huge advantage. This also threatens Nxd4, as both his knight and his pawn are pinned.
moves.19... Rac8: Trying to get my rook involved.
moves.20. Ng5: Hmm, hoping I'll move off that diagonal? But it's a blunder because...
moves.22. Kg3 Nf5+: !! He has to sac his queen!
moves.23. Qxf5 Qxf5: Well skirmish No. 2 has ended, leaving my up by... ten points. Easy game now.
moves.24. Nf3: He's going to make it as hard as he can.
moves.24... Qg6+ 25. Kh3 Qh5+ 26. Kg3 Rc4: I don't really have any particular plan, just trying to find a weakness.
moves.28. Bd2 f5: If he (unwisely) takes en-passant then my f rook will join in the attack.
moves.29. Rg1: He does his best to defend.
moves.29... Qh3: I was tempted to just take his rook, but decided it might go faster this way.
moves.30. Rg3 Qh5: He chases my queen around for a while:
My queen says enough is enough and runs away to e8.
moves.35. Rg3 Qb5: Not for long though. this threatens something very nasty and very obvious.
moves.36. Ng1 Qxb2 37. Nf3: White is hopeless, his bishop is pinned and he's down twelve. I should just get my other rook into the game and then I'll win. Although, it turns out I don't need it.
moves.37... Rf4 38. Kg1 Rxf3: ! If he takes then I take his bishop ending up with two minor pieces for a rook.
moves.39. Bh6: ! I give him this just for threatening mate when he's so far behind.
moves.39... Qf2+: I almost played Rc8 before I realized what he could do then.
moves.40. Kh1 Qf1+ 41. Rg1 Qxg1+: He resigns. I felt I played pretty well, please comment and rate.
